content: For the first quarter of 2022, revenue totaled $1.3 billion, up 7.5% from the prior year, including 150 basis points of unfavorable currency impact. As we look at first quarter revenue by segment, our Education segment continues to report significant year-over-year growth, up 55% as the comparable 2021 period was still impacted by COVID-related disruptions. As we discussed in the fourth quarter earnings call in February and disclosed in our 2021 Form 10-K, in the first quarter, we recognized a $52 million pretax loss on our Persol common stock related to the market value of the shares on the date of the sales compared to the end of Q4 2021 and an additional cost of $15 million related to the transaction, including fees and expenses.
